TopicTitle: [1.8.x - 1.12.x] US Probes Pack - Old and New - 8-26-21

Articles.Content: I am ashamed to say that I recognized exactly none of these.

Update V0.26

-Added Galileo and Magellan spacecraft

-Added Galileo craft file

Galileo and Magellan are released.

Notes on Galileo:

-Please use the craft file, it is difficult to assemble.

-Decouple Galileo atmospheric probe once reaching Jool SOI and use the action groups to stage the parachutes(check the action groups in craft file)

raidernick, would you add another version of Galileo with fully open dish? (i've seen that model)

p.s. really awesome mod))

Edited October 22, 2014 by komatozz

raidernick, would you add another version of Galileo with fully open dish? (i've seen that model)

p.s. really awesome mod))

There is already is...just take the broken dish off and put the other one on.
Any chance of US launch vehicles?
Older ones are fully covered by FASA mod. Modern ones... I've seen a big pack of them somewhere at forum, but can't remember exact mod.

Older ones are *not* fully covered by FASA.

Vanguard

Juno II

Thor-Burner

Thor-Able

Thor-Ablestar

Thor-Delta

Atlas-Able

Thor/Atlas-Agena A

Thor/Atlas-Agena B

Atlas-Centaur

Scout (of various mods)

Saturn I (S-IV upper)

I'm not doing any rockets anyway.

Edited October 23, 2014 by raidernick

Just one addition I hope you can make: please and my absolute favorite US (Technically NASA and ESA, but, ya know, 'Merica): Cassini-Huygens. Its a great 'ol probe, that could have some interesting uses in KSP

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12106-0-24-Lionhead-Aerospace-Inc-Easter-Egg-hunt

Try that out. The probe back includes Cassini-Huygens. It's got good fidelity and pretty much all the functionality it needs.

Just one addition I hope you can make: please and my absolute favorite US (Technically NASA and ESA, but, ya know, 'Merica): Cassini-Huygens. Its a great 'ol probe, that could have some interesting uses in KSP

I plan to do that.

I'm not doing any rockets anyway.

why not? time?

Update V0.27

-Added Vanguard-1 probe

-Added Near Earth Object satellites Dawn, Deep Impact, Deep Space 1, NEAR, Stardust and Ulysses

-Added Inertial Upper Stage booster (cradle will come in a later update)

-Fixed data storage ability of probes
Hey, at some point could you add the TDRS communications satellite that was launched by shuttle?

UPDATE V0.28

-Tweaked solar panels on all crafts

-Fixed craft appearance in editor

-Added dependencies that I forgot to add on the previous update

-NEAR and DAWN engines should work now

-IUS second stage engine nozzle should extend when engine is activated now

Nice parts.

It's there someone with a RemoteTech config file for these?Thanks.

UPDATE V0.28.5

-Fixed FPS lag by replacing all animations with firespitter.dll, this is now a dependency

-Updated all craft files for new animations

-THIS IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH PREVIOUS VERSIONS! YOU MUST COMPLETELY REMOVE OLD VERSION BEFORE INSTALLING THIS!

The animations are broken as of 0.90 until firespitter is updated. Anything with a solar panel will still work but any other animated part won't. If firespitter isn't updated in a relatively short amount of time I will see about trying to move back to the stock animation module.

UPDATE V0.29

-Updated dependencies for 0.90, fixed version of firespitter

-Added PAM/Star48 booster for Magellan

-Added TDRS-M Satellite

-Added manufacturer icon for new sorting system

-Updated craft files, replace your old ones

Edited December 16, 2014 by raidernick

UPDATE V0.29

-Updated dependencies for 0.90, fixed version of firespitter

-Added PAM/Star48 booster for Magellan

-Added TDRS-M Satellite

-Added manufacturer icon for new sorting system

-Updated craft files, replace your old ones

http://i.imgur.com/l48D70G.png

http://i.imgur.com/GjtCKN2.png

Yay! Thanks! This will work great in my upcoming youtube series following the space shuttle

The IUS Booster Second Stage is somehow overriding the new SAS system in career mode. As soon as it's on the vessel activating SAS acts like i would have a level 3 pilot, even if a level 0 scientist is piloting the ship
Presumably because it's a probe core? Unless raidernick wants it to be a particularly *dumb* probe core I'd say it's working as designed.

Every probe has a different level SAS depending on how "smart" it should be. Newer, more advanced probes have more advanced sas units, the older simpler probes have the most basic ones. It is acting as intended.

The thing I noticed that strikes me as odd... is that all of the probes seem to unlock late in the tech tree... where as some like Vanguard should be earlier in the tech tree

Edited December 18, 2014 by tmikesecrist3

The thing I noticed that strikes me as odd... is that all of the probes seem to unlock late in the tech tree... where as some like Vanguard should be earlier in the tech tree

I don't play career at all, ever, so I just copy and pasted generic tech tree settings for all the parts. They are all identical so will unlock at pretty much the same time. I've asked several times if anyone wants to write proper tech tree settings and received no response. I have no intention of doing it myself because I am not interested in career mode.
